p: Thirty, three-years-old, female cynomolgus macaques ( Macaca fascicularis – Noveprim - Mauritius) 2.7 to 5 kg, were group-housed at Sanofi Pasteur (Marcy l'Etoile – France) in large stainless cages with an automatic watering system and were fed with dry monkey chow (Primate Maintenance Diet 107, SAFE, Route de Saint Bris, 89290 Augy, France) and fresh fruits or vegetables daily. Cynomolgus macaques were provided with behavioral enrichment toys and treats daily. Their health status was determined based on complete physical examination, tuberculin skin tests, serology screening (α-herpes virus, SIV, filovirus, HAV, HBV), fecal examination, and culture for parasites and enterobacteria screening.
